title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to persephone
text: outlines propose change persephone. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to persephone
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to persephone
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to persephone
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("agesofman/persephone", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to persephone
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to persephone
text: Please note persephone project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with persephone
text: Thanks using persephone! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with persephone
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with persephone
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with persephone
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: persephone
text: vignette contains general information package. intended give user general picture package features, presenting code architecture clear concise way. package includes dataset corn soybeans progress Nebraska 20 seasons, 2002 2021. user can easily draw data Demeter database create different dataset. details can found cronus Github repository.
code: library(cronus) library(persephone)  # Create a Region object region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Take a look at the data head(progress_ne$Corn) #> # A tibble: 6 × 20 #>   Crop  Stage Season  Time Date       CumPe…¹ Perce…²   dayl    gdd   prcp  srad #>   <chr> <ord>  <dbl> <dbl> <date>       <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Corn  Pres…   2002     1 2002-03-31       1       1 44722. 0.0653 0.0267  386. #> 2 Corn  Plan…   2002     1 2002-03-31       0       0 44722. 0.0653 0.0267  386. #> 3 Corn  Emer…   2002     1 2002-03-31       0       0 44722. 0.0653 0.0267  386. #> 4 Corn  Silk…   2002     1 2002-03-31       0       0 44722. 0.0653 0.0267  386. #> 5 Corn  Dough   2002     1 2002-03-31       0       0 44722. 0.0653 0.0267  386. #> 6 Corn  Dent…   2002     1 2002-03-31       0       0 44722. 0.0653 0.0267  386. #> # … with 9 more variables: swe <dbl>, vp <dbl>, ndvi_smooth_wt1 <dbl>, #> #   adayl <dbl>, agdd <dbl>, aprcp <dbl>, asrad <dbl>, aswe <dbl>, avp <dbl>, #> #   and abbreviated variable names ¹​CumPercentage, ²​Percentage

title: persephone
text: package built using S4 class system, offering simplicity new R users well ease development project core team. Functions require single object holds necessary information concerning model interest. objects class PersephoneModel can concatenated object class PersephoneModelList.
code: # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Tools get_crops(object) #>       Corn   Soybeans  #>     "Corn" "Soybeans" get_region(object) #>       Corn   Soybeans  #> "nebraska" "nebraska" get_index(object, crop = "Corn") #> Corn  #>    1 get_stages(object) #> $Corn #> [1] Preseason Planted   Emerged   Silking   Dough     Dented    Mature    #> [8] Harvested #> 8 Levels: Preseason < Planted < Emerged < Silking < Dough < ... < Harvested #>  #> $Soybeans #> [1] Preseason       Planted         Emerged         Blooming        #> [5] Setting Pods    Dropping Leaves Harvested       #> 7 Levels: Preseason < Planted < Emerged < Blooming < ... < Harvested get_seasons(object) #> $Corn #>  [1] 2002 2003 2004 2005 2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 #> [16] 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 #>  #> $Soybeans #>  [1] 2002 2003 2004 2005 2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 #> [16] 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021

title: persephone
text: Fitting object straightforward function fit(), takes PersephoneModel PersephoneModelList object alters model fitted slots.
code: object <- fit(object) plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)

title: persephone
text: function predict() can take object already fitted calculate model predictions different dataset.

title: persephone
text: evaluation model can achieved crossval() function, performs Monte-Carlo (leave-group-) cross validation alters object’s metrics slots.
code: object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1) plot_metrics(object)

title: persephone
text: Function summary() can used get brief presentation object.
code: summary(object) #> General Information  #>  #> Region: nebraska  #> Crop: Corn  #> Formula: CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd  #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #>  #> Stage: Preseason  #>  #> Call: #> glm(formula = object@formula, family = stats::quasibinomial(link = object@link),  #>     data = data_stage, weights = weights) #>  #> Deviance Residuals:  #>       Min         1Q     Median         3Q        Max   #> 2.107e-07  2.107e-07  2.107e-07  2.107e-07  2.107e-07   #>  #> Coefficients: #>               Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  3.031e+01  7.626e-02   397.5   <2e-16 *** #> Time         1.406e-09  1.374e-02     0.0        1     #> agdd        -1.338e-09  2.851e-02     0.0        1     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> (Dispersion parameter for quasibinomial family taken to be 1.871151e-11) #>  #>     Null deviance: 0.0000e+00  on 759  degrees of freedom #> Residual deviance: 3.3751e-11  on 757  degrees of freedom #> AIC: NA #>  #> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 25 #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #>  #> Stage: Planted  #>  #> Call: #> glm(formula = object@formula, family = stats::quasibinomial(link = object@link),  #>     data = data_stage, weights = weights) #>  #> Deviance Residuals:  #>     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max   #> -8.7769   0.0000   0.0007   0.0768   9.3890   #>  #> Coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept) -6.19860    0.17092 -36.266   <2e-16 *** #> Time         1.14698    0.05762  19.908   <2e-16 *** #> agdd        -0.25097    0.15619  -1.607    0.109     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> (Dispersion parameter for quasibinomial family taken to be 3.261797) #>  #>     Null deviance: 50564.0  on 759  degrees of freedom #> Residual deviance:  2081.7  on 757  degrees of freedom #> AIC: NA #>  #> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 9 #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #>  #> Stage: Emerged  #>  #> Call: #> glm(formula = object@formula, family = stats::quasibinomial(link = object@link),  #>     data = data_stage, weights = weights) #>  #> Deviance Residuals:  #>     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max   #> -6.6953   0.0000   0.0001   0.0274   9.7855   #>  #> Coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. title: persephone
text: Instead executing functions interactively, html report including fitting, evaluation summary model can generated function report().
code: report(object, name = "example_report", path = getwd())

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ioannis Oikonomidis. Author, maintainer. Samis Trevezas. Author, thesis advisor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Oikonomidis , Trevezas S (2023). persephone: Remote Sensing Applications Crop Phenology. R package version 0.0.3, https://agesofman.github.io/persephone/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {persephone: Remote Sensing Applications in Crop Phenology},   author = {Ioannis Oikonomidis and Samis Trevezas},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.3},   url = {https://agesofman.github.io/persephone/}, }

title: Remote Sensing Applications in Crop Phenology
text: Ages Man project applies advanced statistical methodology remote sensing agriculture. composed several R packages, well elements, one focusing different application. persephone R package deals applications crop development.

title: Remote Sensing Applications in Crop Phenology
text: can install development version persephone github running following line code: instead recommended install entirety Ages Man project. details can found agesofman Github repository.
code: devtools::install_github("agesofman/persephone")

title: Remote Sensing Applications in Crop Phenology
text: Detailed documentation, along reproducible examples, can found package vignette vignette(topic = "persephone", package = "persephone").

title: Remote Sensing Applications in Crop Phenology
text: Ages Man project developed Mathematics Department University Athens. project maintainer Ioannis Oikonomidis, working supervision Prof. Samis Trevezas.

title: persephone Model Classes — PersephoneModel-class
text: persephone defines number model classes. Objects belonging model class can passed main package functions fitting prediction.

title: persephone Model Classes — PersephoneModel-class
text: S4 object appropriate class.

title: persephone Model Classes — PersephoneModel-class
text: Details PersephoneCumLink class: Model fitting based ordinal::clm(). Information arguments formula, nominal, scale, link threshold can found .

title: persephone Model Classes — PersephoneModel-class
text: region object class Region. region interest. See package cronus details data data.frame. data model fitted. model . object holding information fitting. fitted data.frame. fitted data. metrics list. list metrics calculated using persephone::crossval(). formula character. model formula. See details. nominal character. nominal effects. See details. scale character. scale effects. See details. link character. link function used. threshold character. type thresholds used. See details.

title: persephone Model Classes — PersephoneModel-class
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList }

what: Average Root Mean Square Prediction Error — armspe
title: Average Root Mean Square Prediction Error — armspe
text: Average Root Mean Square Prediction Error

title: Average Root Mean Square Prediction Error — armspe
code: armspe(data)

title: Average Root Mean Square Prediction Error — armspe
text: data data.frame. data.frame columns Stage, Time spe.

title: Average Root Mean Square Prediction Error — armspe
text: data.frame columns Stage, Time rmspe.

title: Concatenate — c,PersephoneModel-method
text: Concatenate PersephoneModel objects PersephoneModelList.

title: Concatenate — c,PersephoneModel-method
code: # S4 method for PersephoneModel c(x, ...)

title: Concatenate — c,PersephoneModel-method
text: x object class PersephoneModel. ... extra models concatenate.

title: Concatenate — c,PersephoneModel-method
text: object class PersephoneModelList.

title: Concatenate — c,PersephoneModel-method
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Fit object <- fit(object)  # Plot plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)  # Predict predict(object, progress_ne)  # Evaluate object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1) plot_metrics(object)  # Summarize summary(object)  # Report report(object, name = "example_report", dir = getwd()) }

title: Plot carousel — carousel
text: Create interactive carousel plots can added model reports.

title: Plot carousel — carousel
code: carousel(fun, x, ...)

text: fun function. plot function. x object class PersephoneModel PersephoneModelList. ... extra arguments.

title: Plot carousel — carousel
text: function slickR::slickR().

title: Create plot title — create_title
text: Create plot title

title: Create plot title — create_title
code: create_title(crop, seasons)

title: Create plot title — create_title
text: crop character. crop interest. seasons numeric. vector seasons.

title: Create plot title — create_title
text: character. title plot

title: Create plot title — create_title
code: if (FALSE) { create_title("Corn", 2002) create_title("Corn", 2002:2009) }

title: Cross - Validation — crossval
text: Calculate model performance metrics using leave-group-(Monte Carlo) cross-validation.

title: Cross - Validation — crossval
code: crossval(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModel crossval(object, test = 0.25, maxsam = 500, seed = 1)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList crossval(object, ...)

title: Cross - Validation — crossval
text: object object class PersephoneModel PersephoneModelList. ... extra arguments. test numeric. proportion seasons used testing maxsam numeric. maximum number Monte - Carlo samples use. seed numeric. seed used Monte - Carlo sampling.

title: Cross - Validation — crossval
text: list containing calculated metrics.

title: Cross - Validation — crossval
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Fit object <- fit(object)  # Plot plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)  # Predict predict(object, progress_ne)  # Evaluate object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1) plot_metrics(object)  # Summarize summary(object)  # Report report(object, name = "example_report", dir = getwd()) }

title: Persephone model fitting — fit
text: Fit model interest. model fitted model data already inside object, unless extra arguments provided, case model first updated fitted.

title: Persephone model fitting — fit
code: fit(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList fit(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneQuasiBin fit(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneCumLink fit(object, ...)

title: Persephone model fitting — fit
text: object object class PersephoneModel PersephoneModelList. ... extra arguments passed update().

title: Persephone model fitting — fit
text: object class PersephoneModel PersephoneModelList.

title: Persephone model fitting — fit
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Fit object <- fit(object)  # Plot plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)  # Predict predict(object, progress_ne)  # Evaluate object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1) plot_metrics(object)  # Summarize summary(object)  # Report report(object, name = "example_report", dir = getwd()) }

title: Tools — get_crops
text: Access PersephoneModel slots information.

title: Tools — get_crops
code: get_crops(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModel get_crops(object)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList get_crops(object)  get_region(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModel get_region(object)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList get_region(object)  get_index(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList get_index(object, crop = NULL)  get_stages(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModel get_stages(object)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList get_stages(object)  get_seasons(object, ...)  # S4 method for PersephoneModel get_seasons(object)  # S4 method for PersephoneModelList get_seasons(object)

title: Tools — get_crops
text: object object class PersephoneModel PersephoneModelList. ... extra arguments crop character. crop choice.

title: Tools — get_crops
text: vector list vectors

title: Tools — get_crops
code: if (FALSE) {  # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Tools get_crops(object) get_region(object) get_index(object, crop = "Corn") get_stages(object) get_seasons(object) }

title: Plot — plot
text: x S4 object. model interest. y used. ... extra arguments seasons numeric. seasons choice plot. cumulative logical. cumulative percentages plotted? save logical. plot saved? dir character. directory plot saved. file character. file name. width numeric. width plot inches. height numeric. height plot inches. ncol numeric. Number rows plot layout. nrow numeric. Number columns plot layout.

title: Plot — plot
text: plot, created ggplot2 ggpubr. plot returned wrapped inside invisible().

title: Plot — plot
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",                region = region,                crop = "Corn",                data = progress_ne$Corn,                formula = "CumPercentage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",                region = region,                crop = "Soybeans",                data = progress_ne$Soybeans,                formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Fit object <- fit(object)  # Plot plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)  # Predict predict(object, progress_ne)  # Evaluate object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1) plot_metrics(object)  # Summarize summary(object)  # Report report(object, name = "example_report", dir = getwd()) }

text: plot, created ggplot2 ggpubr. plot returned wrapped inside invisible().

title: Plot Metrics — plot_metrics
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  # Create a model object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",              region = region,             crop = "Corn",             data = progress_ne$Corn,             formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel  # Create another model object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",             region = region,             crop = "Soybeans",             data = progress_ne$Soybeans,             formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel  # Concatenate the models object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList  # Fit object <- fit(object)  # Plot plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)  # Predict predict(object, progress_ne)  # Evaluate object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1) plot_metrics(object)  # Summarize summary(object)  # Report report(object, name = "example_report", dir = getwd()) }

title: Update Model — update
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a Region object library(cronus) region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",                  div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))  object <- new("PersephoneCumLink", region = region, crop = "Corn", model = "A") object <- update(object, region = region, crop = "Soybeans", model = "B") }

title: persephone 0.0.2
text: Fixed fit() bug class PersephoneQuasiBin. Added summary() function class PersephoneQuasiBin. Added pkgdown documentation website. Added Codecov badge. Changed report() rendering quiet = TRUE.

title: persephone 0.0.1
text: Created initial version package. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
